ChefsHatGym.Agents package¶

ChefsHatGym.Agents.IAgent module¶

class ChefsHatGym.Agents.IAgent.IAgent(name, saveModelIn, _)¶

Bases: object

This is the Agent class interface. Every new Agent must inherit from this class and implement the methods below.

abstract actionUpdate(observation, nextObservation, action, envInfo)¶

This method that is called after the Agent’s action.

Parameters

  • observation (ndarray) – The observation is an int data-type ndarray. The observation array has information about the board game, the player’s hand, and possible actions. This array must have the shape of (228, ) as follows: The first 11 elements represent the board game card placeholder (the pizza area). The game cards are represented by an integer, where 0 (zero) means no card. The following 17 elements (from index 11 to 27) represent the player hand cards in the sequence. By the end, the last 200 elements (from index 28 to 227) represent all possible actions in the game. The allowed actions are filled with one, while invalid actions are filled with 0.

  • nextObservation (ndarray) – The nextObservation is an int data-type ndarray. The nextObservation array has information about the board game, the player’s hand, and possible actions. This array must have the shape of (228, ) as follows: The first 11 elements represent the board game card placeholder (the pizza area). The game cards are represented by an integer, where 0 (zero) means no card. The following 17 elements (from index 11 to 27) represent the player hand cards in the sequence. By the end, the last 200 elements (from index 28 to 227) represent all possible actions in the game. The allowed actions are filled with one, while invalid actions are filled with 0.

  • action (ndarray) – The action array with 200 elements, where the choosen action is the index of the highest value

  • envInfo ([type]) – [description]

abstract getAction(observations)¶

This method returns one action given the observation parameter.

Parameters

observations (ndarray) – The observation is an int data-type ndarray. The observation array has information about the board game, the player’s hand, and possible actions. This array must have the shape of (228, ) as follows: The first 11 elements represent the board game card placeholder (the pizza area). The game cards are represented by an integer, where 0 (zero) means no card. The following 17 elements (from index 11 to 27) represent the player hand cards in the sequence. By the end, the last 200 elements (from index 28 to 227) represent all possible actions in the game. The allowed actions are filled with one, while invalid actions are filled with 0.

Returns

The action array with 200 elements, where the choosen action is the index of the highest value

Return type

ndarray

abstract getReward(info, stateBefore, stateAfter)¶

The Agent reward method, called inside each evironment step.

Parameters

  • info (dict) – [description]

  • stateBefore (ndarray) – The observation before the action happened is an int data-type ndarray. The observationBefore array has information (before the player’s action) about the board game, the player’s hand, and possible actions. This array must have the shape of (228, ) as follows: The first 11 elements represent the board game card placeholder (the pizza area). The game cards are represented by an integer, where 0 (zero) means no card. The following 17 elements (from index 11 to 27) represent the player hand cards in the sequence. By the end, the last 200 elements (from index 28 to 227) represent all possible actions in the game. The allowed actions are filled with one, while invalid actions are filled with 0.

  • stateAfter (ndarray) – The observation after the action happened is an int data-type ndarray. The observationBefore array has information (after the player’s action) about the board game, the player’s hand, and possible actions. This array must have the shape of (228, ) as follows: The first 11 elements represent the board game card placeholder (the pizza area). The game cards are represented by an integer, where 0 (zero) means no card. The following 17 elements (from index 11 to 27) represent the player hand cards in the sequence. By the end, the last 200 elements (from index 28 to 227) represent all possible actions in the game. The allowed actions are filled with one, while invalid actions are filled with 0.

abstract matchUpdate(envInfo)¶

This method that is called by the end of each match. This is an oportunity to update the Agent with information gathered in the match.

Parameters

envInfo ([type]) – [description]

name = ''¶

Class attribute to store the name of the agent

abstract observeOthers(envInfo)¶

This method gives the agent information of other playes actions. It is called after each other player action.

Parameters

envInfo ([type]) – [description]

raise_timeout(signum, frame)¶

[summary]

Parameters

  • signum (int) – [description]

  • frame (int) –

    ???

Raises:

TimeoutError: [description]

saveModelIn = ''¶

Class attribute path to a folder acessible by this agent to save/load from

timeout(time)¶

This method can be called to make any action of the agent timed out. It adds a timeout for the action function

Parameters

time (int) – time in seconds
